newsitem.title: UK: Closing overseas stock market indices.
newsitem.headline: Closing overseas stock market indices.

text.p: Here is how major stock markets outside the United States ended Monday.

LONDON - Britain's leading stock index ended slightly higher, while the broader market powered to a five-month peak on a favourable outlook for British interest rates and the pound. The FTSE 100 closed at 5,031.9, up 0.6 points, or 0.01 percent.

FRANKFURT - The dollar's slide from last week's highs against the mark and Friday's decline on Wall Street weighed on German stocks, but the firm bond market saved the market from a significant sell-off. The DAX-30 index closed at 4,333.13, down 21.02 points, or 0.48 percent. In later screen-based trade, the IBIS DAX index ended at 4,333.15, down 9.16 points, or 0.21 percent.
PARIS - French stocks finished the day lower, The CAC-40 index closed at 2,983.44, down 12.83 points, or 0.43 percent.

ZURICH - Swiss stocks ended lower despite a spotlight on merger plans by bank concern Credit Suisse Group and insurer Winterthur, both of which ended lower. The Swiss market index closed at 5,825.6, down 39.2 points, or 0.67 percent.

TOKYO - The Tokyo stock market's benchmark Nikkei average tumbled nearly 4 percent to close at its lowest level since the end of April, hurt by the dollar's tumble against the yen and a slide on Wall Street Friday, brokers said. The 225-stock Nikkei average closed at 18,824.18, down 780.28 points, or 3.98 percent.

HONG KONG - Stocks suffered a sharp decline across the board Monday, ending lower after a drop on Wall Street hit local sentiment, but a surge in Hang Seng Bank propped up the performance of the finance sector.
The Hang Seng index tumbled 187.07 points, or 1.12 percent, to close at 16,460.47.

SYDNEY - The Australian stock market closed sharply lower in response to a slump in the local bond market and the plunge on Wall Street Friday. The All Ordinaries index closed 44.2 points down, or 1.63 percent, at 2,667.2

JOHANNESBURG - South African stocks ended down after Wall Street jitters spread to the local market following Friday's steep 156-point fall in New York stocks, dealers said. The All-Stock index closed at 7,583.1, down 16.1 points, or 0.21 percent. The All-Gold index closed at 1,016.3, up 19.7 points, or 1.98 percent, while the Industrial index closed at 9,239.4, down 44.0 points, or 0.47 percent.
